title: Jenna Ortega's Latest “Wednesday ”Press Look Left Her Struggling to Get Up the Stairs, According to Her Stylist
description: The actress' "super slim pencil skirt" was to blame
content:
NEED TO KNOW
• None Jenna Ortega's stylist, Enrique Melendez, revealed that her latest Wednesday press look caused her to struggle getting up the stairs
• None The actress wore a "super slim pencil skirt" made out a of black patent leather that limited her movement
• None The outfit continued Ortega's gothic glamour look ahead of the show's premiere

Jenna Ortega's goth glam fashion streak continues — but not without a hitch.

The Wednesday actress is continuing her season 2 press tour for the show, and stopped in Seoul to meet with fans while wearing a black patent leather crocodile embossed dress that hailed from Dilara Findikoglu's autumn/winter 2025 collection.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

The dress featured several silver lace-up grommet details through the corset bust, angular sleeves, and an ultra fitted skirt. She completed the look with black eyeliner, faint blush, nude pink lipstick and her edgy bleached eyebrows.

After Ortega shared an Instagram carousel of her look Monday, her stylist, Enrique Melendez, shared what was really going on behind the scenes on his Instagram Stories.

"As I let her struggle up the stairs in a super slim pencil skirt to take a video," he captioned a video of Ortega inching her way up the steps.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

Ortega and Melendez have been working together since 2016, and have evolved the actress' style in the process. The stylist revealed that Ortega's day-to-day fashion is much more subdued, but she allows him to put her in more over-the-top, fashion-forward goth looks.

"Jenna's personal style is super simple, super streamlined. She would wear the same thing if she could every single day," he said in an Aug. 7 interview with The Hollywood Reporter. "I tell her thank you, because a lot of times, it's just for me."

Melendez explained that Ortega is an easygoing client and appreciates "the arts, a cinephile, music." He added, "I think after Wednesday came out, it just became her thing — goth glam — but it wasn't something that we forced or that we tried to do, it was natural."

Ortega's Wednesday press tour style has contained an array of dark looks with a whimsical and gothic edge. For the Aug. 11 season 2 press conference in Seoul, South Korea, she wore a mint green Simone Rocha top from the brand's spring 2025 collection that was printed with abstract painted faces, and paired the top with a layered Simone Rocha skirt from the fall 2025 collection.

Even off duty, Ortega has continued to incorporate gothic glamour into her party looks. On July 30, she attended the Wednesday season 2, part 1, after party at The Royal Opera House in London and went ghostly for the evening.

She wore a champagne-colored scoop neck dress from DKNY’s resort 2004 collection that contained delicate chiffon straps and a delicate flared skirt. Ortega completed the look with a black snakeskin Kurt Geiger clutch, Santoni pumps and jewelry by Zales.

keywords.name: Jenna Ortegas goth glam fashion streak

summary: Jenna Ortega's latest press appearance was seen struggling to get up the stairs due to her gothic glamour look. Her stylist, Enrique Melendez, revealed that the actress wore a "super slim pencil skirt" made out of black patent leather that limited her movement. The dress was from Dilara Findikoglu's autumn/winter 2025 collection and featured silver lace-up grommet details. Melendez has been working with Ortegas since 2016 and has evolved her style to include more over-the-top fashion-forward looks.
shortSummary: Jenna Ortega's latest goth glam look struggled to move her up the stairs, highlighting her struggles with physicality and social influences.

Jenna Ortega, 22, Reveals She's Been Writing a Screenplay for 'Almost 10 Years' That She Plans to Direct The ‘Wednesday’ star also said she views acting as a “stepping stone” to her real dream: get behind the scenes By Bailey Richards Bailey Richards Bailey Richards is a writer-reporter at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2023 and interned with the brand in 2022. Her work has previously appeared in digital publications like Paper Magazine and TV Insider. People Editorial Guidelines Published on April 30, 2025 11:49AM EDT Leave a Comment Jenna Ortega. Credit : Ethan Miller/Getty Jenna Ortega has been working on an original screenplay for "almost 10 years," she revealed in an April 28 V magazine interviewThe actress, 22, is now "starting to take the steps to get it made," and wants to not only direct but star in it, she revealedElsewhere in the interview, Ortega said she does not "want to be in the things that I create in the future," and acting has been a "stepping stone" to behind-the-scenes work While her peers were worried about homework, 12-year-old Jenna Ortega was writing a movie — which she now wants to direct. For the past few years, the Disney Channel alum, 22, has been booked and busy, establishing herself as a household name through her work in Wednesday, the Scream franchise and more. Now, she wants to get behind the camera — and with the screenplay she’s been workshopping for a decade, no less. While chatting with her Hurry Up Tomorrow costar and collaborator Abel Tesfaye (a.k.a. The Weeknd) for V magazine, Ortega revealed that she has been working on an original script for “almost 10 years,” and she has big plans for it. Jenna Ortega Shares Mom's 2010 Facebook Video That Launched Her Career: 'The Rest Is History' (Exclusive) “I have a script that I’ve known that I was going to make for almost 10 years,” she said in the interview, published Monday, April 28. “It’s weird because it’s something that I thought of when I was younger and when I first started out in this field, and it’s only now that I’m actually starting to take the steps to get it made, which is really interesting.” Jenna Ortega in 'Hurry Up Tomorrow'. Andrew Cooper/Lionsgate But the actress would not have done it any other way, she told Tesfaye, 35. The screenplay’s decade-long incubation period, Ortega explained, was informed by her own experience in the industry in a valuable way. “There’s so much that goes on behind the scenes that I wasn’t aware of. I’m just putting the puzzle pieces together in my head,” the Death of a Unicorn star explained in the V chat. “So I think I needed a few years of that under my belt to understand the order of doing things.” Jenna Ortega Admits She 'Could Have Used My Words Better' After Facing Controversy for Rewriting Her Wednesday Lines "Everything that I’ve done in my career, I feel like there’s a reason why I didn’t make this story at an earlier time, but I’m really excited about it,” the X star continued. “I think learning how to produce and being a part of projects in that way has informed me so much.” Now, the original screenplay — the content of which she did not share, or even hint at — is in the early stages of development, Ortega revealed. But she has a few other projects coming down the pike first. Jenna Ortega and The Weeknd in 'Hurry Up Tomorrow'. Andrew Cooper/Lionsgate “Then there are a couple of other things I’m trying to develop right now, but it’s strictly off of being inspired by another actor or a writer, characters that I’ve never really gotten the opportunity to play before,” the Beetlejuice Beetlejuice star told Tesfaye. “They’re very different preparation processes.” “So for me,” the actress continued, “it’s always fun to try something new. But I think oftentimes to get the stories that you want to get made nowadays, you kind of have to start them yourself.” Jenna Ortega Responds to Miller's Girl Sex Scene Controversy: 'It's Not Supposed to Be a Comfortable Movie' And, after Tesfaye asked Ortega if she wants to star in the film, she revealed that more than anything, she wants to direct it. “This one in particular, I see myself in it, but I really want to direct,” she said. “That’s probably the main thing that I want to do. I see that for myself. I just feel that’s the way my brain wants to work and think, and that’s how I even view my acting sometimes.” Elsewhere in the chat, Ortega said she views acting as a “stepping stone” to what she really wants to do — direct, produce and all-around be behind the scenes. Jenna Ortega. Taylor Hill/FilmMagic "It’s hard to develop something that you’re starring in or you’re leading. I’m sure you experienced that firsthand now, where it’s just this weird kind of mind f---,” she told Tesfaye, who not only stars in Hurry Up Tomorrow alongside Ortega, but also co-wrote and produced the film. (Ortega is also credited as an executive producer on the movie.) “I don’t want to be in the things that I create in the future,” she continued in the V chat, “but starting out, because I’ve created more leverage for myself with a name as an actor, I may as well use that as a stepping stone.” Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human-interest stories. Hurry Up Tomorrow is in theaters May 16. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Celebrity Celebrity News

Jenna Ortega Keeps Bleached Eyebrows in Latest Gothic Look Celebrating Wednesday The actress looked ethereal in a spooky design from Andreas Kronthaler for Vivienne Westwood from the designer's fall 2025 collection By Ingrid Vasquez Ingrid Vasquez Ingrid Vasquez is a Digital News Writer at PEOPLE. She graduated from The University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelor in Journalism. Before joining the team, she worked as an Editor at FanSided and provided work in the celebrity and lifestyle space for brands that include Teen Vogue, Cosmopolitan, EW, and more. People Editorial Guidelines Published on July 31, 2025 08:04PM EDT 1 Comment Jenna Ortega in France for the 'Wednesday' Paris premiere on Thursday, July 31, 2025. Credit : Kristy Sparow/Getty NEED TO KNOW Jenna Ortega attended Wednesday's season 2, part 1 premiere in Paris, France, on Thursday, July 31The actress looked ethereal in a spooky design from Andreas Kronthaler for Vivienne Westwood from the designer's fall 2025 collectionOrtega is currently on a promotional run for the show Jenna Ortega is adding a touch of glamour to Wednesday Addams' trademark look. The actress, 22, is currently on a promotional tour for season 2 part 1 of Wednesday, set to debut on Netflix on Wednesday, Aug. 6. She arrived in France for the show's Paris premiere on Thursday, July 31, in a brown, ethereal design from Andreas Kronthaler for Vivienne Westwood from the designer's fall 2025 collection. The goth fairytale look features a deep V ruffled design, paired with an exposed nude corset, all brought together by a thin brown belt. The bottom of the dress had a short train and a knee-high slit. The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! Jenna Ortega in France for the 'Wednesday' Paris premiere on Thursday, July 31, 2025. Kristy Sparow/Getty Similar to her appearance at the Season Two: Part One World Premiere of the show in London just a day prior on Wednesday, July 30, Ortega kept her bleached eyebrows, but this time opted for a softer pink lip, rosy cheeks, and mascara. Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! She accessorized with a black statement necklace with a large pendant in the shape of a cross and wore her hair down in soft waves. Her accessories also included Bondeye Jewelry Yellow Gold Aphrodite Diamond and Black Spinel Hoop Earrings. The look was a contrast to the champagne-colored silk Donna Karen archival gown that Ortega wore to Wednesday's Season Two: Part One World Premiere afterparty in London. Jenna Ortega attends the 'Wednesday' season 2, part 1 world premiere afterparty on July 30, 2025. JP/RV/TM / BACKGRID The brown and nude color scheme is one Ortega has been following as she attended the show's London red carpet event in a nude Ashi Studio FW25 Couture gown. The serpentine-inspired figure-hugging dress features a snakeskin design that runs from its high neck to its peplum skirt. Ortega wore the look with Jimmy Choo shoes and silver Rainbow K jewelry that added contrast. Related Stories Wednesday Season 2: Everything to Know About the Hit Netflix Series' Next Chapter (Including Lady Gaga's Guest-Starring Role!) Jenna Ortega Reveals 'Very Patronizing' Aspect of Working on 'Wednesday' That She Has Found 'Annoying' Bringing together the look were Ortega's nude nails and slicked back ponytail that showcased her glam: bleached eyebrows, a berry red lip color, spider lashes, and a hint of purple eyeliner. Ortega's style inspiration from her character comes as no surprise, as she previously told Vogue in April 2023 that she has "always respected goth culture." Jenna Ortega attends the 'Wednesday' season 2, part 1 world premiere on July 30, 2025. Samir Hussein/WireImage "I've always had a darker sense of humor, but I never felt like I was able to express that. Now I feel like I can embrace those qualities in myself," she said. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Season 2, part 1 of Wednesday will debut on Netflix on Wednesday, Aug. 6, followed by part 2 on Wednesday, Sept. 3. Season 1 of Wednesday is available to stream in full on Netflix. argos_summary: Jenna Ortega continues her gothic glamour fashion streak during the press tour for 'Wednesday' season 2, recently wearing a black patent leather dress that limited her movement, as revealed by her stylist Enrique Melendez. The dress features intricate details and is part of Dilara Findikoglu's autumn/winter 2025 collection. Ortega's style has evolved since she began working with Melendez in 2016, allowing her to embrace more dramatic looks while her personal style remains simpler.
